page.title: 07 Breedon Church
page.content: The present church building was built by Augustine Monks, and is 1,310 years old. There are six church bells,which are kept in the church tower. All the bells except bell No.4 were made by John Taylor and Co. from Loughborough. The oldest bell was made in 1604 and its weight is 9cwt. There are 40 pews in the church.These are 225 years old. In the graves yard are many graves so there is a plan of where people are buried so people can find the correct grave easily. The earliest gravestone is inside the church,dated 1570. The Vicar of the church, in 1985, is the Reverand Osbourne. He has conducted 90 marriage services and he has different robes for different occasions in the Christian Calendar.
